alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 09 at 1:30PM CST until March 10 at 12:19AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Shreveport LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Glover River At Glover affecting McCurtain County. For the Glover River...including Glover...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Glover River At Glover. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, The Glover River is at flood stage with minor flooding at its confluence with the Little River west of Golden, Oklahoma. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM CST Thursday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 17.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.7 feet on 05/12/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued at 1000 PM CST.
